pageContext.claim: “We inherited a system that's broken. It's a system where many people have just -- it's taken months and months and months to get many people that do not have the complex financial -- you know, complicated financials -- they don't have that, and it's still taken months.”
pageContext.analysis: This is false. The system worked relatively efficiently and quickly under previous administrations. At one point the White House tried to blame a relatively obscure office manned by career officials as a bottleneck but that office would flag problems for higher-ups. The Trump White House granted many interim clearances and then did not follow up when snags emerged with the people who had been hired.
